Reviews.Content: A Terrific Hotel....the best service! Our stay at this hotel was one of the best experiences that we had on our first trip to Italy. To say that the staff were helpful and friendly would be and understatement. They made us feel like family and we really hated to leave them. Our room was comfortable, clean and quiet but nothing could compare to the service and the friendliness of the staff. They catered to our every need and they did so with sincerity and a smile each time that we turned to them for help. The breakfast that was included in our stay was wonderful and the staff greeted us each morning with a smile and friendly conversation. Our trip to Italy included a stay in Rome, Florence and Venice and unfortunately the hotels that we stayed in our other two locations did not compare to the Atlantic Palace. The staff at the Atlantic hotel made our trip to Florence like a trip home to visit family...our sincere thanks to Annika, Vincenzo, Maurizio, Giusy, MIchaela, and Giancarlo. We look forward to seeing all of them again in the near future. Thank you all for making our first visit to Firenza so wonderful. Karen and Nick....
Reviews.Author: kosmo1

Reviews.Content: LOVED IT! I've stayed at the Atlantic Palace twice, once in 2006 and I just came back from there this year, some other friends stayed at the Macchiavelli Hotel which was a very nice hotel, they also had a very good experience.Both are clean, they have a very nice staff and in the city's best position ever! LOVE IT! And if I had the opportunity to come back to Florence I would definitely come back there.
Reviews.Author: JustMe1Mexico

Reviews.Content: "Excellent - Charming, Friendly and Full of Character" Having booked to stay in this hotel before reading the reviews we were a little unsure whether we had made the right decision......having just returned from Florence i can honestly say we definately made the right decision. From the moment we walked in the door we were made extremely welcome, we had abandoned our car about 1/2 mile away and they arranged for their valet parking to collect it for us and park it and when ever we wanted to use it, it was brought back to the hotel for us. The reception staff were very helpful in providing us with maps and local information on where the best places to eat were.The rooms were lovely and spotlessly clean and stayed that way all the time we were there, daily maid service saw to that. The room was spacious and well furnished.Its location is ideal for all the sights of central Florence and although located on a busy street, once you enter the door you are cocooned away from the trafiic and noise. The public areas are beautiful and again well furnished, bright and airey.Breakfast every morning was fantastic, it catered for all tastes having a full range of cereals, fresh fruit, yoghurt, bacon, scrambled egg, local bread, preserves, meat, cheeses etc etc. I would not hesitate in recommending this hotel to anyone who was thinking of staying in Florence.10 out of 10Thanks to all the staff for a lovely stay!!!
Reviews.Author: govnher

Reviews.Content: Pretty terrible I am amazed this hotel qualifies as a four star. It is more like a 2/3 star. On the plus side, it was very clean and the staff were friendly and helpful. The downsides were:No bar, no restaurant and a truly terrible buffet breakfast. There is no-one making coffee or tea, so the only option is the machine coffee, which tasted like marmite.Total disparity in the rooms. Five of us stayed, I was in a pokey corridor with two single beds up against the wall. Others had better rooms but terrible bathrooms.Heating/air con was inexplicable. Sometimes it would be freezing, other times boiling hot. I lost track of the number of guests I heard complaining about this over the poor breakfast.Location wise it is fine, but then Florence is so small, any hotel is well located. If you go here, please do not expect a four star. And eat out for breakfast!
Reviews.Author: emg57

Reviews.Content: Great Location This hotel was clean and comfortable. The rooms were of better than average size, and nicely furnished. The location was outstanding---accessible to many of attractions in the city as well as the train station. The only complaint we had was with the staff;they were not entirely up front with us when we asked them to make museum reservations for us, and as a result, we overpaid for them.
Reviews.Author: canadianvisitor48

Reviews.Content: disapointing hotel a disappointing hotel-in a good location-expensive,dissapointing hotel-nice ,new room-the air condition didnt work at all. unpleasant ,non unhelpful, non polite staff- the final vote-3hanna schulman, israel
Reviews.Author: annaisrael

Reviews.Content: Awful staff, low budget       Hotel lobby - ancient vase
Reviews.Author: HonestGemini

Reviews.Content: Never Never a Four Star Hotels are awarded stars by their facilities. The Atlantic Palce does not have a Restaurant (Just a breakfast Room) It doesn't have a Bar (Just a little counter in a dark corner which is never manned). It has a small Reception desk with a Receptionist who is making and recieving calls, (an awful lot of them!) checking people in and out whilst trying to be the Concierge. It doesn't work!!!!There is one lift which at a push will take two people and a piece of luggage.Our bedroom was so small that we immediately put the two office type chairs outside in order to make a little more room they were useless anyway as the desk was to small to sit at and the other chair was behind the bathroom door which opened IN to the room. We were told that for safety reasons we couldn't have an iron and board in our room but surprise they had a pressing service.Good points?? First class breakfast, Comfortable bed and good shower unit. Oh and a valet parking service which seems a boon on the very busy one way street until you get the bill for 21.50 euro per DAY not night there is a difference!!
Reviews.Author: Toni Brian

Reviews.Content: yuck! dusty old place! We stayed here three nights (too many) in a room at the end of a tiny hall way that felt like a fire hazard. The room was terribly dusty and the terrace looked at the dirty rooftops of apartment buildings. Needless to say, we didn't use the terrace. The elevator was the smallest one i have ever seen. Florence did not impress me at all as it was extremely dirty, rank smelling just dingy. The street merchants were very pushy and almost assaulted people. I did not feel safe in this city and would not go back for a second visit. We had mushy lasagna, overcooked salmon (overpriced) and were so happy to leave!
Reviews.Author: MeANDmyshadow

Reviews.Content: STILL HERE AND WILL DO ANYTHING TO SWITCH My wife and I are currently at an internet cafe right by the Atlantic Palace Hotel. All we can say is that the hotel has truly ruined our experience in Florence. The location is excellent, but this dump should be torn down and rebuilt. Maybe theyll get it right next time.
Reviews.Author: jrjUsa

Reviews.Content: Stay away!!! It is absolutely horrible hotel with the most awful stuff I`ve ever seen. Rooms are not so bad - they even have some kind of atmosphere, as the hotel is in very old building - but they are dirty and old. It is definately not 4 star, I would give to this hotel 2 stars maximum. The worst part was bathroom - it was small and extremly ugly. So were the corridors and the common areas. They have minibar in rooms, but not glasses - only plastic cups, what is not normal in 4 star hotels. The breakfast was horrible also. The location is not so bad. of course, it is not in the fancy area, but very close to the central market, which is very nice experience in Florence. Duomo is appr. 10 minutes walk.But anyway, my advise is - stay away, there are much better hotels in Florence!
Reviews.Author: traveller55555

Reviews.Content: Not Worth the Price Skip this hotel....The hotel was ridiculous, for the $$$ price we paid. Location is on a very busy and small street, and there was no place to stop the car to unload luggage, because the hotel had allowed a car and lots of scooters to block the front doors and entrance. We reserved two rooms through AAA, and both were smelly, with peeling paint, mold in the bathrooms, and a multi room-shared patio, which we discovered the next morning, when there was a stranger sitting outside our room on the small patio, smoking his cigarette. The hotel charges extra for internet service, and breakfast is included, but nothing special. The elevator in the hotel is nothing short of scary...old, cramped, not for those with claustrophobia. The staff are only marginally helpful, and some, down right surly. When we contacted our travel agent to complain about the hotel, AAA apparently contacted the hotel, and one of the staff practically acosted my husband about it. Very unprofessional.The only positive feature we can remark on, is that it is close to the train station and the site where many of the tours originate.We were truly puzzled with how they can use the word palace in their name, as both of our teens nicknamed this hotel the Atlantic Dumpster, instead.Sign us, Disgusted in NC
Reviews.Author: TravelingXX

Reviews.Content: Not bad but wouldn't stay there again Spent five nights there. Excellent location, the staff was very friendly and not a bad hotel, BUT our room faced the street, therefore noisy, it was supposed to be a non-smoking room (I'm allergic to smoke) and the room itself was, but smoke came in throughthe vents and therefore no longer a smoke free room. The beds were okay and the room was fairly clean, but the shower leaked and didn't drain very well, therefore I was standing in water above my ankles while taking a shower. Asked the staff to fix it and they said they would and tried...didn't work. We could have moved to another room, but after talking to two other guests, we decided we didn't want to know what surprises the next room may hold. I wouldn't stay there again, but would definately stay somewhere in that area.
Reviews.Author: BellaRialto

Reviews.Content: Great Hotel        Bathroom
Reviews.Author: ChrisCMichigan

Reviews.Content: Give it a miss!       The vent through which smoke, light, and noise filled our room at night
Reviews.Author: Dewfactor

Reviews.Content: OK but not special Florence is an absolutely beautiful city and we had a brilliant holiday. The Atlantic Palace Hotel was a nice enough place to stay but nothing out of the ordinary. It's near the train station so easy to find but in a pretty scruffy street. The room was clean and comfortable with some original features but small and had a nice view of a brick wall! Bathroom also small but clean. The breakfast we tried (once) was terrible. Stale bread and dreadful coffee (unexcusable considering Italy is one of the homes of great coffee) This hotel is fine if you're going to be out of the room most of the day like we were, and we got a pretty good deal for it on Expedia. Wouldn't be my first choice for another visit though.
Reviews.Author: A42

Reviews.Content: excellent location and lovely hotel booked hotel online after reading reviews, not dissapointed. Excellent location, 5 mins walk from station so if you arrive by coach as we did from Pisa it's only a short walk away. Nowhere in florence is far away, all within easy walking distance of the hotel. Rooms were comfortable, with high ceilings and all that you would expect from a 3 star hotel. A nice touch was the bottle of sparkling wine left in our room on my birthday. Breakfast was continental style with plenty of choice. Hotel doesn't look much when you arrive, but more than adequate for all your needs, and close to everything. Would stay here again gladly.
Reviews.Author: SueWales

Reviews.Content: Really nice hotel We really enjoyed our stay at this wonderful hotel.We were really suprised by the lovely bottle of Martini left in our room on my birthday which was a lovely suprise and very thoughtful of the hotel staff - a really nice touch that was much appreciated! The staff were very friendly and helpful and when the hot drinks machine broke down at breakfast, they soon got the coffee brewing for everyone! I think they should abandon the machine altogether as their coffee was far superior to the machines! The only little complaint I have - fresh orange juice would be nicer than the machine they have for juice in the morning which was the waterery powder variety. Other than that everything was great.The bedroom was lovely and big with very nice furnishings and a view of the Duomo! The location is excellent for exploring the city and is a short walk from the train station and from where the airport bus arrives and departs from which is very handy. Also close to pick up stop for numerous guided tours. We will definitely recommend this hotel to anyone who might be staying in Florence and we would certainly stay here again should we return to Florence.
Reviews.Author: renahockney

Reviews.Content: Close to Everything This was our first visit to Florence and there are a lot of choices when it comes to hotels. We came across this place on the internet and booked it. When we arrived via train from Pisa, we were pleasantly surprised to have the hotel located right near the train station (very convenient). The staff was very helpful in recommending a restaurant that evening too! In fact they were very nice when we asked them for anything.Our room was quaint and the king size bed was really, really comfortable. The exposed wood beams really added something to the whole room. Only downfall of our room would have to be the shower. The water was nice and warm and pressure was good, but the shower head holder was busted. No big deal and it didn't ruin our 2 night stay.The hotel is very, very close to walk to everything that Florence has to offer. One word of advice is that when you are going to the museums you should try and pre-book some tickets instead of standing in line for long periods of time.I would recommend this place for all it has to offer, except I feel that this was more like a 3 star hotel rather than a 4 star. We would definitely stay here again!
Reviews.Author: rangerfan23

Reviews.Content: Great Location We booked this hotel for two nights about one week before arriving through Continental One Pass since we were having difficulty finding accomodations last minute in Florence for three adults (My son, daughter and myself). We had a charming room that was clean and well-kept in the back with two twin beds together and another twin separted by a wall. The bathroom was modern and well-stocked with toiletries and had a bathtub with shower. A continental breakfast was included each morning. The staff was helpful in giving directions. This hotel was located around the corner from the Open Market with fabulous buys on t-shirts, sweatshirts, cashmere scarves and leather goods. Be sure to bargain! The prices cannot be beat through Italy. We had to buy an extra suitcase to carry home all our treasures. There are numerous excellent restaurants all within walking distance. I went to the Duomo while my kids slept early one morning. It is about a 5 minute walk. I was able to walk, get on line for a ticket and then visit the Duomo all within 1 1/2 hours and was back before my kids got up. We walked all over Florence from this hotel. It is clean and located a few blocks from the train station. We felt safe here and would definitely return.
Reviews.Author: Tranquillo

Reviews.Content: Great hotel Stayed 3 nights at the Atlantic Palace and thought it was great. It is 4-star by Italian standards, which I reckon equates to a good 3-star by UK standards. Location is ideal for the SMN station as the hotel is only 5 mins walk away. Don't be alarmed by the proximity to the station...this is not the usual downmarket area normally associated with railway stations. Lovely wooden-beamed ceilings and a good, old-fashioned relaxing hotel. I would certainly use it again.
Reviews.Author: iwmcarthur

Reviews.Content: The hotel is a palace Our room was beautiful and spacious. It was also very clean. The hotel is very close to the train station in a nice neighborhood. It also close to most of the major sights including the Uffizi and Accademia. Breakfast was large and consisted of assorted pastries, fruits, cheeses, meats and yogurt. The staff spoke English and helped us to arrange some tours. Internet service is available for a nominal fee. I would highly recommend this hotel.
Reviews.Author: NewName123

Reviews.Content: Small hotel, close to train station        The corridor to enter the room
Reviews.Author: ahs4y

Reviews.Content: Disappointing We stayed for three nights in what is rated as a 4-star hotel. Our room turned out to be a very small bedroom, with a very small bathroom, in a hotel that looked somewhat rundown, especially in the hallways. We booked this, as well as our other hotel reservations in Rome and Venice through an online agency, choosing from listings of 4-star hotels. The hotels in the other cities were lovely, the Atlantic Palace in Florence was not. On the plus side, there was a very nice buffet breakfast, and the front desk staff was friendly and helpful. However, overall the Atlantic Palace was a disappointment.
Reviews.Author: MarkNYCity

Reviews.Content: Safe bet Our superior double at The Atlantic had a view of the Duomo (main Cathedral.) Good air con and bathroom, cleaned regularly - as you would expect for 180 euros a night. Lovely period furniture and shutters. Tiny old lift and cranky TV only signs of tiredness. Inclusive breakfast pretty good. The hotel is near the rail station hence a bit of a bustle. But it's far enough down the street, and close enough to the Duomo and the lovely market for the location still to be pretty good. South of the Duomo around Uffizi seemed the best district for ambience.Snooty desk staff shrugged when I asked for an iron to press a shirt for a wedding. Said hotel policy was not to lend out irons for safety reasons - poor service for 4*. Made some lame crack about the creased look being in fashion. There went his tip. But desk staff did recommend a great restaurant around the corner.Florence seems to be a city full of expensive hotels of variable quality - it's such a tourist trap that it gets away with it. But the Atlantic is pretty good.
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member

Reviews.Content: Very romantic room We stayed in June 2006, and were pleasantly surprised with the room. Beautiful roof and interior decorations. The A/C worked great and the bathromm was great. Very clean. Breakfast in the morning was a nice spread with plenty of options included in the price. Dining room was very nice. Would definitely stay and recommend. Nice staff and great location. Close to everything. Neighborhood has many shops and stores. Very close to rail station (about a block and a half).There is a daily flea market that is around the block from the hotel. It should quench the averarage tourists thirst for bargains.
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member

Reviews.Content: Book this hotel!!!!!!!!! My husband and I had a lovely experience here! We were there at the end of May, 2006 for our honeymoon. The staff were so friendly and responsive. We were greeted on the sidewalk, had our bags taken in for us, and personally escorted to our room. There is an array of tourist information in the lobby and the front desk staff were more than willing to make recommendations of things to do! The room was very spacious and there was a regular shower! It is right around the corner from the train station and there are tons of cute cafes' and restaurants all around! The breakfast was typical, but be sure to ask for caffe americano or caffe latte if you don't want espresso...this seemed to be the only hotel that would serve espresso if you did not clarify. All in all a great value....we were so sad to go, and would love to go back!
Reviews.Author: Sheri76

Reviews.Content: great little place to stay this is a great place to stay--1st trip to Italy and had some other hotels probs. Not here--a/c rooms--helpful staff, good food. We got in to the city early on Sunday, the concierge helped us with planning our next couple of days. He suggested we go to Pisa on Monday when all the museums are closed in Florence, and see Florence on Sunday and Tuesday,they gave us the tour info and schedules. Hotel is a great match for the city. Wont go wrong here.
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member

Reviews.Content: Great location and rooms We enjoyed our 3-day stay there. The staff were very helpful and friendly , they helped us pick the best tours out of Florence. The room was very clean. The hotel is walking distance to the train station and to amost everywhere in the city. we will go back for sure!
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member

Reviews.Content: I Never Wanted To Leave!!!!! I loved this hotel. This was my first trip to Europe and my girlfriend had selected the hotel. It was fantastic-the location was right in the middle of everything. It was easy to find from the train station and everything (except Piiti Palace but that was sort of a waste anyway). I CANNOT stop raving about the breakfast-yummy breads, meats, cheeses, pastries, cookies, snacks, cereals, fruit, juice, lattes and coffee...I could go on and on. All free!! I imagine that we saved quite a bit of money by having such a large breakfast (and keeping some of it for snacks). The staff was ever so polite and they always had excellent recommendations. I would go back to this hotel in an instant! My only caveat would be however, avoid the gelatteria directly across the street. The gelato was rather icy and given that there was an abundance of yummy gelato to be found (try it on a waffle-it is divine!), I was sad that we had wasted our time with this one. This was an exceptional hotel and I would highly recommend it to anyone!! I am jealous that you get to go to Florence and this hotel in particluar.
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member

Reviews.Content: Atlantic Palace: A great place to stay in Florence Atlantic Palace is a great hotel, we stayed there for 3 nights. The rooms were clean, fresh and spacious. It鈥檚 only 10 minutes walk from all of the key attractions, but it has the downfall of being on the very busy Via Nazionale. Florence is an excellent place to visit and the Atlantic Palace was good value for money in a convenient location.
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member

Reviews.Content: A fine hotel in an Excellent Location Of all the hotels we have stayed in during our travels to Europe, the Atlantic Palace is one of the better hotels. When we first checked in, we were initially placed in a front room with street noise from Via Nazionale. The staff later changed our room to an interior room, which was quiet, even when we had to open the windows at night. The room was clean, spacious, and comfortable. The bathroom was well-equipped but with a tight shower, but the shower worked very well.The breakfast area, with its separate buffet room, was one of the most comfortable we've experienced in any hotel in Europe- and this considering the small size of the hotel. The buffet had a wide variety of fresh fruits, yogurt, cereals, breads, pastries and breakfast cold cuts, more than enough food to start your day off with. The coffee was usually strong in the European manner. We never had to wait for a table in the morning.The location is on the very busy Via Nazionale- a very heavily trafficked street with narrow sidewalks. However, it's only a six minute walk to the train station. And many of Florence's most important sites are well within walking distance.Florence is a great city full of history and beauty. And the Atlantic Palace is a good place to stay. If you get it in a package, it's a good value as well.
Reviews.Author: JCandJC

Reviews.Content: Great Hotel and Location We enjoyed four nights at the Atlantic Palace, the staff were very friendly, upon arrival we chatted to the reception staff telling them we were staying in Florence for our first wedding anniversay, once we were shown to our room which was a good size, bathroom could have been larger but very clean, we were delivered complimentary a bottle of Sparkling wine to celebrate our anniversary which we thought was a lovely touch. The Hotel is placed in a very good location, serves good breakfast, we had a wonderful time.
Reviews.Author: Cleanroom

Reviews.Content: Don't Waste Your Money!! I found the staff exceptionally rude and arrogant. They clearly thought of themselves as superior to their guests. I even heard someone working at the front desk make a condescending remark about a guest when he thought no one could hear. Later a woman came in to ask for directions and he was rude to her and nearly pushed her out the front door. Then when I waited in the lobby for a friend, another woman came in from off the street to see a vase on display in the lobby and was told to leave immediately because she was not a guest!! I have traveled to Florence often and have seen some snobs there, but this hotel exemplified the absolute worst!! I was embarrassed to be there.
Reviews.Author: QueenEsther

Reviews.Content: fabulous! We stayed in this hotel at the end of March. We took our infant with us. There was a baby bed in the room when we checked in. The service was excellent. They were happy to bring us extra towels, etc.. We even bought milk for the baby at the hotel bar, and kept it in the fridge in our room. The room was a nice size. The floor could've been cleaner, but it wasn't too bad. The bathroom looked a little outdated, but it was extremely clean (And I am a clean freak!). The room had an ambience with the antique furnishings. The breakfast were excellent. There was a lot of choice, and the coffees were great too! The location could not have been better. We managed to get the baby, the pram, and three suitcases from the train station to the hotel no problem. The staff were very friendly. And there is an EXCELLENT restaurant close by the hotel. It is called Ciro and Sons. We ate there everyday of our stay, if not for lunch then for dinner. It's a lovely place, not the sort that you normally take children, but the owners went out of there way to entertain our toddler. They even brought out a little Micky Mouse cup and bowl for her to use. I would reccomend the hotel and the restaurant to anyone.
Reviews.Author: BelleCopelan

Reviews.Content: Great location, decent hotel We booked a triple here for our Florence trip 3/2006. The hotel is in possibly the best location there is: literally 1+ blocks from the Santa Maria Novella train station (though it is in hotel row, with dozens of other hotels similarly located in the area), and a quick easy walk to the San Lorenzo marketplace and Duomo. The lobby is spacious, clean, and quite beautiful, but the room was a bit more disappointing. Our triple consisted of a king bed + a poorly placed twin bed right bedside the door/bathroom (it looks like they squeezed in the twin bed at the last minute type of thing). Also our toilet wouldn't stop flushing after a use, thus had to call the porter to come fix it. Breakfast downstairs in the morning was great, with hot options as well. Overall, this is a typical decent little European hotel, with all the basic amenities and services you would expect. Great hotel if you want a central location that has decent facilities, but don't go here expecting extreme luxury.
Reviews.Author: Bostongirl_MA

Reviews.Content: Wonderful hotel! Great value and helpful staff! We just returned from a wondeful holiday in Firenze. The Atlantic Palace was a perfect location that combined modern comforts with history. We had a room with wonderful wood beamed ceilings and large windows. The rooms are nicely decorated and very clean. Anyone we encountered from housekeeping to the front desk staff members were all helpful and friendly. They even grciaously entertained our attempts to speak the beautiful Italian language...all without making us bashful to try. The front desk staff (we seemed to have had contact with all shifts during our stay) was very knowledgeable with just about anything we had questions about. This was a wonderful hotel for the price...a great value for all travelers (young people, couples, families). Thank you for your hospitality Atlantic Palace!!
Reviews.Author: jace710

Reviews.Content: Excellent value if packaged Great location. Rooms and bathroom typically small for European hotel, but they were very clean.
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member

Reviews.Content: Very nice place A very nice hotel. Very pricey, but very clean, comfortable and nice. Great location near the railway station and close to the flea markets, which were a great find. Lots of fun shopping at the flea markets. From our window at night we could view the very beautiful Duomo. The breakfasts were very good. I would recommend this one if you don't mind paying 200+ Euro/per night.
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member

Reviews.Content: Best of Three The best of three hotels used in Italy in September '05. All three were rated 3 out of 5, but this was the only 3. It had room, tall ceilings, good breakfast, and helpful staff. Be careful of Internet pictures of Italian hotels and promotional materials. Go one rating higher than you would in the USA. We were disappointed in two of three hotels we just used.
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member

Reviews.Content: one of the best of our trip Very good location-close to train station and museums, etc. Staff was very helpful and breakfast was very good. We stayed in 5 diiferent hotels throughout europe and this room was the largest. Only regret was that we only had one night there.
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member

Reviews.Content: excellent Compare to 4* hotel in Rome or sheraton 5* in florence, where I just came back, Atlantic palace H is a lots better. Breakfast has more varieties and better quality. Reservation desk was very helpful, hospitality. Amenities in the toilet is better than 5* hotel. Excellent location!!!
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member

Reviews.Content: Adequate   showReview(2810051, 'full');
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member

Reviews.Content: Very nice :)   showReview(2511234, 'full');

Reviews.Content: Liked it hope 2 come back   showReview(2511216, 'full');

Reviews.Content: Good base for sightseeing - overall good value;not luxury   showReview(1887037, 'full');

Reviews.Content: une 茅toile de trop !?   showReview(12371110, 'full');
Reviews.Author: Pat_Mezieres

Reviews.Content: P茅simo Hotel       Ducha
Reviews.Author: nicolettaAlicante

Reviews.Content: 銇撱亷銈屻亜銇儧銉嗐儷   showReview(19163931, 'full');
Reviews.Author: lass=
